content.text:
Let me analyze the target structure and provide the building instructions:

Analysis of the Main Target Image:
The structure consists of two distinct parts:
1. Left part: A complex structure with multiple layers including:
   - A red arch piece in the middle
   - Yellow blocks on the sides
   - Blue and green blocks on top
   - Orange triangular roof pieces
2. Right part: A simple pillar structure with:
   - Two orange cylindrical columns
   - Yellow rectangular blocks at top and bottom
   - Orange triangular roof piece

Total layers: 3-4 layers depending on the section
Total blocks used: Approximately 15-16 blocks

Block selection and assembly order:
{
    Step1: Move block with index 8  // Bottom yellow base for left structure
    Step2: Move block with index 7  // Bottom yellow block left side
    Step3: Move block with index 7  // Bottom yellow block right side
    Step4: Move block with index 1  // Red arch piece
    Step5: Move block with index 6  // Green block top left
    Step6: Move block with index 5  // Blue block top right
    Step7: Move block with index 14 // Orange triangle roof left
    Step8: Move block with index 15 // Orange triangle roof right
    Step9: Move block with index 8  // Bottom yellow base for right structure
    Step10: Move block with index 9 // Left orange cylinder
    Step11: Move block with index 9 // Right orange cylinder
    Step12: Move block with index 8 // Top yellow block for pillars
    Step13: Move block with index 14 // Orange triangle roof for pillar structure
}

This assembly sequence will create both structures as shown in the target image, maintaining the correct spatial relationships and orientations of all blocks.
